thread.title: Tracy Morgan does stand-up comedy for 1st time since N.J. car crash
thread.title_full: Tracy Morgan does stand-up comedy for 1st time since N.J. car crash

author: Bobby Olivier | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Tracy Morgan does stand-up comedy for 1st time since N.J. car crash
text:
MORE: Tracy's Morgan's surprise Emmys appearance (VIDEO) 
The set, which might have been a warm-up for his scheduled hosting gig on "Saturday Night Live" this upcoming weekend, comes four weeks after Morgan took the stage at the Primetime Emmys and received a standing ovation. 
The "SNL" alum then provided an emotional speech, and said "I'm honored to be at the Emmys. I always have been honored to be here. It's been a long road back." My first time on stage in 16 Months at the #ComedyCellar ! Picking up the pieces! pic.twitter.com/T2uD2Zndot â€” Tracy Morgan (@RealTracyMorgan) October 13, 2015 
The 46-year-old sustained a traumatic brain injury and several broken bones after a collision with a Wal-Mart tractor-trailer June 7, 2014. He was in a coma for eight days. The accident killed his mentor James "Jimmy Mack" McNair. 
Both on the Emmys and during a June "Today" show interview , he's repeatedly thanked his doctors and his new wife Megan Wollover for nursing him back to health. 
Bobby Olivier may be reached at bolivier@njadvancemedia.com. Follow him on Twitter @BobbyOlivier . Find NJ.com on Facebook .
